info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 3:24PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT THE BUFFALO METRO AREA AND LOCATIONS NORTH AND EAST DURING THE EVENING COMMUTE... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 321 PM EST, a snow squall extended from Niagara Falls to North Tonawanda to Rapids. The snow squall is moving south at 10 mph, and will move across Interstate 290 and Interstate 90 through 430 PM EST. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Grand Island, Pendleton, Pembroke, Akron, Erie Basin Marina, and Alden. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 53. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
